reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is classed as a 1 star, but our room was surprisingly well-equipped : (very)large double bed ; AC plus programmable fan, which we used more; (very) small bathroom with adequate sized shower and even a hair-dryer ; plenty of wardrobe space ; table and chair.
reviews.title: Unfavourable location for the sights & dreadful customer service!

reviews.text: Being an 'economy' room on the 3rd floor, we had no real view as such, only some rooftops, but who cares when you can step outside and be right in the heart of it ...

reviews.text: The hotel is not luxurious like the Sofitel round the corner, but it is spotlessly clean and the staff are welcoming and pleasantly unobtrusive.
reviews.title: Fabulous place for budget traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only a stroll away to Piazza Roma, the train station and car parks. You may ask for a room with the canal view too. 15 mins walk to the St Marcos Square. Around 6 to 7 O'clock in the evening, you may hear people singing on the Gondolas in the canal and it's a good experience. The room is quite but small. I found biscuit crumbs on the sheet. The shower drainage is bad. Only recommend for the budget stay and location.
reviews.title: Great location at a fair price

reviews.text: We booked the hotel on Booking.com and spent the extra euros for a canal view room. It was worth it to watch and hear the gondolas as they went by. The view was good and it was close to the train station and grand canal. Breakfast buffet was cold foods -- ham and cheese and rolls. There was juice and hot drinks.
reviews.title: Get a canal view room

reviews.title: The smart choice in Venice
reviews.text: We loved the reasonable hotel fee, spacious and authentically-furnished room (heavy wooden pieces), modern bathroom, and accessibility. Very clean and convenient. No elevators though, but this helps keep the price of the hotel down I guess. Hearty European breakfast of bread, ham, jams etc was served at the restaurant beside it (which incidentally serves amazing pasta and wine, frequented by locals for dinner). It was a 5-10 minute walk from the bus station, wheeling our suitcases. It takes a little longer to walk to the train station. To get to the train station, because we refused to take the expensive water taxis, we had to lug our suitcases on staired bridges, but it was worth the savings. Since it was near the bus and train stations, it was very easy to tour Venice as vaporetto (water buses?) stations were located in the bus and train stations too. The hotel is situated in the less picturesque area of Venice, but it wasn't a problem as Venice is pretty small and it was interesting to walk through the interesting narrow streets to get to San Marco, the opera, etc etc.

We LOVED this small hotel. Accomodations were immaculate and bathroom was modern. Our room overlooked a canal in which we saw gondolas complete with accordian players. The included breakfast was next door in a quaint restaurant. Staff was extremely helpful. It is a very easy 5 minute walk from the train station. Would definately stay here again!
reviews.title: GREAT place to experience Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Venice several times and try to stay at different locations each trip. In November 2007 we stayed at the Locanda Salieri after reviewing it on tripadvisor. This was a super little hotel. for our north american cousins. Venice is an expensive place to stay. Also the size of the room will be small, in some cases very small unless paying 400+ euros a night, then you can get a reasonable size room. The Salieri is very close to the bus terminus [pizzale Roma] and vaperetto [public water taxi's] less than 10 minutes walk, over 2 bridges. the Locanda is by a canal and has a small reception area [tiny] up some stairs are the rooms, so if you have difficulty in walking up stairs this is not for you. our room was on the first floor which was a normal size room for venice. very clean. small bathroom with shower, toilet and bidet. good hot water from the shower. we were bed and breakfast. breakfast was held in the next door ribo restaurant. this had a very large garden patio at the back. buffet breakfast with a hot choice. plenty of variety to start the walking day. The staff were very friendly at both the locanda and restaurant. we had dinner at the restaurant on one of our evenings. It was very good with a much more extensive toscana and venetian menu [than you will find in many venice bistro's and restaurants] with a wonderful wine list. [it has a small seperate wine area where we had some antipasta for late lunch and a super bottle of 2003 Valpolicella]. If you like chocolate have the chocolate souffle- it is to die for. The Locanda is in easy walking distance for the Friari; Campo Margherita ; Railway station. I Would recommend both the Locanda and the restaurant. Will stay again on one of your trips..
reviews.title: Great Value for Venice

reviews.text: I was rather worried by the 1 star rating, but this turned out to be a really fantastic find. Excellent value for money, very clean and tidy, great shower and comfortable beds. Helpful, friendly staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay

reviews.text: I stayed here two nights and didn't want to leave. I had reserved a budget room for 70 euro per night. I left my bag with them in the morning because I was going on an all day trip to the Dolomites. When I got back, reception gave me a key and sent me upstairs. I opened the door to this beautiful spacious room and thought there had been a mistake, even though my bag had been delivered. I went back downstairs and spoke with reception. He told me I had been upgraded at no charge to a 100 euro room. I was ecstatic. This room (#4 ) had a king bed, private bathroom, TV, and, wait for it, a canal view balcony! I had dreamed of this room but never expected to see it on my budget. I was in heaven. It had marble floors and walls, armoire, desk, luggage rack, large mirror in entryway, two night stands, a chair and a phone. The bathroom had a marbled shower, pedestal sink, mirror, hair dryer, and towel rack. It looked newly renovated. It was spotless with the exception of a long black hair in the sink. The balcony was facing a little canal that had light traffic that included gondolas. There was a double wrought iron planter containing red geraniums, and shutters. If you look to your left, you will see church bells that peal on the hour. It was an utterly charming, peaceful and beautiful setting.
reviews.title: Heavenly room, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 24-hour reception from the first minute was welcoming and friendly and spoke English well. I was given a Venice map without asking. There was a thoughtful shelf of books for guests as well as a full umbrella stand. There are 12 rooms on three floors. To get a view ask for numbers 3, 4, 7, 8, 11, or 12. Breakfast is included and is served from 8:30-9:30 in the Ristorante Ribo next door. There is garden dining for lunch and dinner here which looked very inviting, but I ate elsewhere.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel in good neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in the Santa Croce district just minutes from Piazzale Roma, so it's a perfect location to get the buses and vaparettos. I loved this hotel and would not stay anywhere else if I came back to Venice.
reviews.title: The right place to live Venice

reviews.text: This one star hotel was a nice surprise. The staff spoke enough English to make us feel comfortable. It is easily accessible from the train station and Piazzale Roma where the airport bus arrives. It is a 15 minute walk to Rialto and 30 minute walk to San Marco Piazza. We enjoyed the walks and getting back to our hotel in a quiet neighborhood. We had a room with a very small balcony on the canal, which I would highly recommend. It is definitely worth the extra cost. The gondolas regularly went by with accordion players and vocalists adding to the ambience. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was decent size but the lighting was not good. The room was typical small European but ours had an extra twin bed.
reviews.title: Great place to stay. Great staff. Great price.

reviews.text: The rooms are confortable, clean and romantic, just opening the windows you can see the laguna!An the location is perfect to live Venice you just need to walk a bit and you will be everywhere in Venice.The staff are nice and very friendly.Book there!;-)
reviews.title: Great location, great rooms
